@mattkenworthy In 2008 we installed a wireless router on the control room roof & a WiFi gadget on the encoder & problem solved.
@mattkenworthy For 44 years AAT made do without the 2 least significant bits from the windscreen encoder, too much electrical noise.
@mattkenworthy The slip rings used for transfer encoder signals from the rotating to non-rotating parts of the dome never worked well.
@mattkenworthy In 2008 we fixed a 44 year old issue by installing WiFi inside the dome of the @AAOastro Anglo-Australian Telescope...

It would of course be very easy to design a gate with sensors at a wide enough range of heights so they wouldn't slam on anything, but no.
...slam shut on passengers or their stuff, regardless of what they do. No, in his mindset that's just the way it is.
I wasn't actually walking slowly but what struck me was that it clearly would never occur to him that ticket gates *shouldn't* actually...
...staff member ambled over to free it, with accusatory 'Well, if you walk slowly through a single gate it'll do that.', etc.
Old Cityrail 'blame the passengers' attitude at @T1SydneyTrains Wynyard station. Ticket gate slams shut on my case as I walk through &...
